document.comment: Generated automatically from Godot engine sources.

section.title: MeshDataTool
section.paragraph: Helper tool to access and edit Mesh data.

section.title: Description
section.paragraph: MeshDataTool provides access to individual vertices in a Mesh. It allows users to read and edit vertex data of meshes. It also creates an array of faces and edges.
To use MeshDataTool, load a mesh with create_from_surface(). When you are finished editing the data commit the data to a mesh with commit_to_surface().
Below is an example of how MeshDataTool may be used.

div.name: R0RTY3JpcHQ=
QyM=

section.paragraph: See also ArrayMesh, ImmediateMesh and SurfaceTool for procedural geometry generation.
Note: Godot uses clockwise winding order for front faces of triangle primitive modes.

section.title: Method Descriptions
section.paragraph: void clear() ðŸ”—
Clears all data currently in MeshDataTool.
Error commit_to_surface(mesh: ArrayMesh, compression_flags: int = 0) ðŸ”—
Adds a new surface to specified Mesh with edited data.
Error create_from_surface(mesh: ArrayMesh, surface: int) ðŸ”—
Uses specified surface of given Mesh to populate data for MeshDataTool.
Requires Mesh with primitive type Mesh.PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES.
int get_edge_count() const ðŸ”—
Returns the number of edges in this Mesh.
PackedInt32Array get_edge_faces(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns array of faces that touch given edge.
Variant get_edge_meta(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns meta information assigned to given edge.
int get_edge_vertex(idx: int, vertex: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the index of the specified vertex connected to the edge at index idx.
vertex can only be 0 or 1, as edges are composed of two vertices.
int get_face_count() const ðŸ”—
Returns the number of faces in this Mesh.
int get_face_edge(idx: int, edge: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the edge associated with the face at index idx.
edge argument must be either 0, 1, or 2 because a face only has three edges.
Variant get_face_meta(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the metadata associated with the given face.
Vector3 get_face_normal(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Calculates and returns the face normal of the given face.
int get_face_vertex(idx: int, vertex: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the specified vertex index of the given face.
vertex must be either 0, 1, or 2 because faces contain three vertices.

div.name: R0RTY3JpcHQ=
QyM=

section.paragraph: int get_format() const ðŸ”—

Returns the Mesh's format as a combination of the ArrayFormat flags. For example, a mesh containing both vertices and normals would return a format of 3 because Mesh.ARRAY_FORMAT_VERTEX is 1 and Mesh.ARRAY_FORMAT_NORMAL is 2.
Material get_material() const ðŸ”—
Returns the material assigned to the Mesh.
Vector3 get_vertex(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the position of the given vertex.
PackedInt32Array get_vertex_bones(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the bones of the given vertex.
Color get_vertex_color(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the color of the given vertex.
int get_vertex_count() const ðŸ”—
Returns the total number of vertices in Mesh.
PackedInt32Array get_vertex_edges(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns an array of edges that share the given vertex.
PackedInt32Array get_vertex_faces(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns an array of faces that share the given vertex.
Variant get_vertex_meta(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the metadata associated with the given vertex.
Vector3 get_vertex_normal(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the normal of the given vertex.
Plane get_vertex_tangent(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the tangent of the given vertex.
Vector2 get_vertex_uv(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the UV of the given vertex.
Vector2 get_vertex_uv2(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the UV2 of the given vertex.
PackedFloat32Array get_vertex_weights(idx: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns bone weights of the given vertex.
void set_edge_meta(idx: int, meta: Variant) ðŸ”—
Sets the metadata of the given edge.
void set_face_meta(idx: int, meta: Variant) ðŸ”—
Sets the metadata of the given face.
void set_material(material: Material) ðŸ”—
Sets the material to be used by newly-constructed Mesh.
void set_vertex(idx: int, vertex: Vector3) ðŸ”—
Sets the position of the given vertex.
void set_vertex_bones(idx: int, bones: PackedInt32Array) ðŸ”—
Sets the bones of the given vertex.
void set_vertex_color(idx: int, color: Color) ðŸ”—
Sets the color of the given vertex.
void set_vertex_meta(idx: int, meta: Variant) ðŸ”—
Sets the metadata associated with the given vertex.
void set_vertex_normal(idx: int, normal: Vector3) ðŸ”—
Sets the normal of the given vertex.
void set_vertex_tangent(idx: int, tangent: Plane) ðŸ”—
Sets the tangent of the given vertex.

Note: Even though tangent is a Plane, it does not directly represent the tangent plane. Its Plane.x, Plane.y, and Plane.z represent the tangent vector and Plane.d should be either -1 or 1. See also Mesh.ARRAY_TANGENT.
void set_vertex_uv(idx: int, uv: Vector2) ðŸ”—
Sets the UV of the given vertex.
void set_vertex_uv2(idx: int, uv2: Vector2) ðŸ”—
Sets the UV2 of the given vertex.
void set_vertex_weights(idx: int, weights: PackedFloat32Array) ðŸ”—
Sets the bone weights of the given vertex.

abbreviation.explanation: This method should typically be overridden by the user to have any effect.
This method is required to be overridden when extending its base class.
This method has no side effects. It doesn't modify any of the instance's member variables.
This method accepts any number of arguments after the ones described here.
This method is used to construct a type.
This method doesn't need an instance to be called, so it can be called directly using the class name.
